title: Vector representation of velocity and acceleration

content.question: An object is moving in the <math alttext="x y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-coordinate plane. The components of the object’s velocity are <math alttext="v sub x equals 5 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="v sub y equals, open parenthesis, 3 t minus 6, close parenthesis, meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace></mrow><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> . The components of the object’s acceleration are <math alttext="a sub x equals, open parenthesis, t minus 7, close parenthesis, meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="a sub y equals, open parenthesis, 4 t minus 2, close parenthesis, meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> . Which of the following vectors best represents the velocity and acceleration of the object at <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents an arrow labeled v sub x, pointing down and to the right. Another arrow labeled a sub x is pointing up and to the left.
The figure presents an arrow labeled v sub x, pointing down and to the right. Another arrow labeled a sub x is pointing down and to the left.
The figure presents an arrow labeled v sub x, pointing to the left. Another arrow labeled a sub x is pointing down and to the left.
The figure presents an arrow labeled v sub x, pointing to the right. Another arrow labeled a sub x is pointing down and to the left.
The figure presents an arrow labeled v sub x, pointing to the right. Another arrow labeled a sub x is pointing up and to the left.

content.answer: The figure presents an arrow labeled v sub x, pointing to the right. Another arrow labeled a sub x is pointing up and to the left.
